segment.source: Microsoft network server Disconnect clients when logon hours expire (Windows 10)
segment.target: Microsoft network server Disconnect clients when logon hours expire (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server Disconnect clients when logon hours expire security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server Disconnect clients when logon hours expire security policy setting.

segment.source: Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire
segment.target: Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting enables or disables the forced disconnection of users who are connected to the local device outside their user account's valid logon hours.
segment.target: This policy setting enables or disables the forced disconnection of users who are connected to the local device outside their user account's valid logon hours.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, client computer sessions with the SMB service are forcibly disconnected when the client's logon hours expire.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, client computer sessions with the SMB service are forcibly disconnected when the client's logon hours expire.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, established client device sessions are maintained after the client device's logon hours expire.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, established client device sessions are maintained after the client device's logon hours expire.

segment.source: Client device sessions with the SMB service are forcibly disconnected when the client device's logon hours expire.
segment.target: Client device sessions with the SMB service are forcibly disconnected when the client device's logon hours expire.

segment.source: If logon hours are not used in your organization, enabling this policy setting will have no impact.
segment.target: If logon hours are not used in your organization, enabling this policy setting will have no impact.

segment.source: The system maintains an established client device session after the client device's logon hours have expired.
segment.target: The system maintains an established client device session after the client device's logon hours have expired.

segment.source: If you enable this policy setting, you should also enable Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire.
segment.target: If you enable this policy setting, you should also enable Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This policy setting can be configured by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to be distributed through Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: This policy setting can be configured by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to be distributed through Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: If this policy is not contained in a distributed GPO, this policy can be configured on the local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in.
segment.target: If this policy is not contained in a distributed GPO, this policy can be configured on the local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: If your organization configures logon hours for users, it makes sense to enable this policy setting.
segment.target: If your organization configures logon hours for users, it makes sense to enable this policy setting.

segment.source: Otherwise, users who should not have access to network resources outside of their logon hours can continue to use those resources with sessions that were established during allowed hours.
segment.target: Otherwise, users who should not have access to network resources outside of their logon hours can continue to use those resources with sessions that were established during allowed hours.

segment.source: Enable the Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire setting.
segment.target: Enable the Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire setting.

segment.source: If logon hours are not used in your organization, this policy setting has no impact.
segment.target: If logon hours are not used in your organization, this policy setting has no impact.

segment.source: If logon hours are used, existing user sessions are forcibly terminated when their logon hours expire.
segment.target: If logon hours are used, existing user sessions are forcibly terminated when their logon hours expire.
